Name: Three U.S. troops in Syria suffer minor injuries in rocket attacks
description: The U.S. military responded with airstrikes that killed at least two suspected militants.

Name: "Gaps remain": U.S. responds to latest draft of Iran nuclear deal
description: Israel's prime minister has branded the deal on the table a "bad one," and warned it will give billions of dollars to Iran and its regional militia groups.

Name: Zelenskyy says Russia has put world "on the brink of radiation catastrophe"
description: Ukraine's president called for the global nuclear watchdog agency to take control of the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant.

Name: 22 killed in Independence Day attack in Ukraine, Zelenskyy says
description: Ukraine's president says Russian forces have launched a rocket attack on a train station in central Ukraine on the country's Independence Day, killing at least 22 people and wounding about 50.

Name: Spain allows suspected gunman to be euthanized before trial
description: Victims had argued that Sabau should not be helped to die before his trial, but two Spanish courts ruled that the accused's right to seek assisted suicide prevailed.

Name: 17-year-old sets record for solo flight around world
description: His sister, Zara, who finished her own trip global flight in January at age 19, previously held the ultralight record.

Name: Prized Galileo manuscript turns out to be a fake, university says
description: The document highlighting the discovery of Jupiter's moons​, described as one of the "jewels" of the library's collection, appears to have actually been written in the 20th century.

Name: 6 months into Putin's brutal invasion, Ukraine is as defiant as ever
description: His country has refused to back down, and now Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says it will retake all the territory seized by Russia.

Name: Hundreds evacuated in underwater train tunnel between U.K. and France
description: "There was a woman crying in the tunnel, another woman having a panic attack," said one passenger left stuck in the tunnel thanks to a broken down train.

Name: Chinese province plans to ban the sale of gasoline-powered cars
description: The idea is to curb climate-changing carbon emissions. Cities there would develop "zero-emissions zones" where fossil fuel-powered vehicles would be prohibited.

Name: Biden announces $3 billion in additional aid to Ukraine
description: "This will allow Ukraine to acquire air defense systems, artillery systems and munitions, counter-unmanned aerial systems, and radars to ensure it can continue to defend itself over the long term," the president said.

Name: Europe's drought is likely the worst in 500 years, officials say
description: Extreme heat and a lack of precipitation have plagued Europe for months, causing rivers to shrivel up, crops to die and wildfires to scorch people's homes.

Name: "Luxurious" 1,200-year-old mansion unearthed in Israel
description: Underneath the courtyard, archaeologists were surprised to discover subterranean vaults made of stone.

Name: The AI of the tiger: A high-tech bid to save an iconic species
description: Campaigners want help building a database of images of tigers' unique coats, hoping artificial intelligence can help them save the animals from extinction.

Name: U.S. airstrikes hit Iran-backed militia infrastructure in Syria, U.S. says
description: The strikes in an oil-rich province came days after Iran-backed groups used drones to aim at U.S. personnel in the region. No casualties were suffered in that attack.

Name: Uvalde school board fires police chief after mass shooting
description: Pete Arredondo was accused of making several critical mistakes during a mass shooting that left 19 students and two teachers dead.

Name: Biden cancels up to $20,000 in student loan debt for millions of Americans
description: Under the plan, borrowers earning less than $125,000 a year will be eligible for up to $10,000 in loan forgiveness, with an additional $10,000 for Pell Grant recipients.

Name: Jury awards Vanessa Bryant $16 million in Kobe Bryant crash site photos trial
description: A jury ruled that Los Angeles County must pay Kobe Bryant's widow $16 million after deputies and firefighters allegedly took and shared photos of the crash scene.

Name: Harvey Weinstein granted appeal of his 2020 rape conviction
description: Weinstein was sentenced to 23 years in prison for sexually assaulting two women.

Name: Judge rules Idaho can't criminalize abortion needed for emergency care
description: Under Idaho's new law, performing an abortion on a "clinically diagnosable pregnancy" is a felony which could carry a prison sentence of up to five years.

Name: Do presidents have the right to withhold privileged material from Archives?
description: How executive privilege and the Presidential Records Act apply to Trump.

Name: Here's who is eligible for Biden's student loan forgiveness plan
description: More than 40 million Americans may qualify, with income the main factor that determines who qualifies for relief.

Name: Biden administration moves to formalize DACA, shield it from legal challenges
description: More than 600,000 unauthorized immigrants who arrived in the U.S. as children are able work and live in the U.S. without fear of deportation under the Obama-era DACA policy.

Name: Three U.S. troops in Syria suffer minor injuries in rocket attacks
description: The U.S. military responded with airstrikes that killed at least two suspected militants.

Name: California set to move forward with plan to ban sale of all gas cars by 2035
description: The plan requires all vehicles sold after 2035 to be zero-emission.

Name: Three U.S. troops in Syria suffer minor injuries in rocket attacks
description: The U.S. military responded with airstrikes that killed at least two suspected militants.

Name: Do presidents have the right to withhold privileged material from Archives?
description: How executive privilege and the Presidential Records Act apply to Trump.

Name: Judge rules Idaho can't criminalize abortion needed for emergency care
description: Under Idaho's new law, performing an abortion on a "clinically diagnosable pregnancy" is a felony which could carry a prison sentence of up to five years.

Name: Man indicted in 1986 murder of 20-year-old college student
description: Essex District Attorney Jonathan Blodgett said John Carey, 63, will be charged with first-degree murder in the death of Claire Gravel.

Name: This is how much money workers want to change jobs
description: As millions of Americans quit their jobs in search of better pay, new research shows how much money they need to make the leap.

Name: 5 takeaways from Twitter whistleblower Peiter Zatko
description: Revelations from Twitter's former head of security raise serious questions about what the platform tells users and regulators.

Name: IRS to refund 1.6 million people who missed tax filing deadlines
description: Tax agency will forgo some late-payment fees for tax filers who were affected by the public health crisis.

Name: Here are the least and most expensive Big Macs in U.S.
description: Like everything else, the cost of fast food is rising, but in some states it's more affordable than others.

Name: Here's who is eligible for Biden's student loan forgiveness plan
description: More than 40 million Americans may qualify, with income the main factor that determines who qualifies for relief.

Name: Three U.S. troops in Syria suffer minor injuries in rocket attacks
description: The U.S. military responded with airstrikes that killed at least two suspected militants.

Name: Do presidents have the right to withhold privileged material from Archives?
description: How executive privilege and the Presidential Records Act apply to Trump.

Name: "Gaps remain": U.S. responds to latest draft of Iran nuclear deal
description: Israel's prime minister has branded the deal on the table a "bad one," and warned it will give billions of dollars to Iran and its regional militia groups.

Name: Barr advised not to bring obstruction charges against Trump after Mueller report
description: Mueller felt he could not to reach a conclusion as to whether the then-president might have obstructed the investigation, leaving the decision on obstruction charges to the Justice Department.

Name: Biden administration moves to formalize DACA, shield it from legal challenges
description: More than 600,000 unauthorized immigrants who arrived in the U.S. as children are able work and live in the U.S. without fear of deportation under the Obama-era DACA policy.

Name: Judge rules Idaho can't criminalize abortion needed for emergency care
description: Under Idaho's new law, performing an abortion on a "clinically diagnosable pregnancy" is a felony which could carry a prison sentence of up to five years.

Name: Congressman's wife died after taking herbal remedy, coroner's report says
description: A coroner's report, obtained by Kaiser Health News, says Lori McClintock died​ from dehydration due to gastroenteritis caused by "adverse effects of white mulberry leaf ingestion."

Name: Jill Biden has "rebound" COVID case
description: First lady Jill Biden tested positive for COVID-19 in an apparent ""rebound"" case and will return to isolation. She first tested positive last week.

Name: First lady Jill Biden tests positive again with "rebound" case of COVID-19
description: First lady tested positive for COVID-19 on Wednesday with an apparent "rebound" infection and will return to isolation, her office said in a statement.

Name: One car accident leads to vastly different ambulance bills for same services
description: The woman was charged thousands more than her sister and brother after all three siblings were injured in an accident last year.

Name: Three U.S. troops in Syria suffer minor injuries in rocket attacks
description: The U.S. military responded with airstrikes that killed at least two suspected militants.

Name: "Gaps remain": U.S. responds to latest draft of Iran nuclear deal
description: Israel's prime minister has branded the deal on the table a "bad one," and warned it will give billions of dollars to Iran and its regional militia groups.

Name: Zelenskyy says Russia has put world "on the brink of radiation catastrophe"
description: Ukraine's president called for the global nuclear watchdog agency to take control of the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant.

Name: 22 killed in Independence Day attack in Ukraine, Zelenskyy says
description: Ukraine's president says Russian forces have launched a rocket attack on a train station in central Ukraine on the country's Independence Day, killing at least 22 people and wounding about 50.

Name: Spain allows suspected gunman to be euthanized before trial
description: Victims had argued that Sabau should not be helped to die before his trial, but two Spanish courts ruled that the accused's right to seek assisted suicide prevailed.

Name: Jerry Allison, drummer for Buddy Holly, dead at 82
description: Drummer Jerry Allison, who played and co-wrote songs with rock pioneer and childhood friend Buddy Holly and whose wife inspired the classic "Peggy Sue," has died.

Name: Celebrity chef Mario Batali settles 2 lawsuits alleging sexual assault
description: The former Food Network personality was acquitted of sexual misconduct in May.

Name: "House of the Dragon" premiere draws in nearly 10 million viewers
description: It was the largest audience for any new original series in HBO's history.

Name: Fetty Wap faces mandatory 5-year sentence after guilty plea
description: The rapper and five others were arrested last October and charged with conspiracy to distribute and possess controlled substances.

Name: Virginia Patton Moss, "It's a Wonderful Life" actor, dead at age 97
description: Moss was known for her role as Ruth Dakin Bailey in Frank Capra's "It's a Wonderful Life" and was the last surviving adult cast member from the film.

Name: 5 takeaways from Twitter whistleblower Peiter Zatko
description: Revelations from Twitter's former head of security raise serious questions about what the platform tells users and regulators.

Name: Nicholas Thompson on Twitter whistleblower
description: In a federal complaint, a former Twitter employee alleged the social media company is "grossly negligent" in its information security and that it has shared misleading information with regulators. Nicholas Thompson, CEO of the Atlantic and former editor-in-chief of Wired, joins "CBS Mornings" to discuss the allegations and the potential consequences for Twitter.

Name: Boy finds courage to jump into lake
description: The former security chief of Twitter has filed an explosive whistleblower complaint against the company. Peiter Zatko claims Twitter executives buried “egregious deficiencies” in the company’s cybersecurity practices. Cat Zakrzewski, a technology policy reporter for The Washington Post who co-wrote the article breaking this story, joins CBS News to discuss.

Name: Elon Musk subpoenas ex-Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey in legal fight
description: Tesla CEO wants to back out of a $44 billion agreement to acquire the company that Dorsey helped found.

Name: NASA begins final preparations for maiden flight of $4.1 billion SLS rocket
description: NASA plans to launch its new moon rocket on August 29 to kick off a long-awaited 42-day mission.

Name: Prized Galileo manuscript turns out to be a fake, university says
description: The document highlighting the discovery of Jupiter's moons​, described as one of the "jewels" of the library's collection, appears to have actually been written in the 20th century.

Name: The AI of the tiger: A high-tech bid to save an iconic species
description: Campaigners want help building a database of images of tigers' unique coats, hoping artificial intelligence can help them save the animals from extinction.

Name: Most marine species will face extinction without limiting fossil fuels
description: A new climate report card paints a grim future if emissions aren't reduced: "Climate change is rewiring marine ecosystems at an alarming rate."

Name: NASA begins final preparations for maiden flight of $4.1 billion SLS rocket
description: NASA plans to launch its new moon rocket on August 29 to kick off a long-awaited 42-day mission.

Name: Federal government orders Arizona to cut water
description: The federal government will impose new restrictions on the amount of water Arizona and Nevada can take from the Colorado River. CBS News' Tony Dokoupil and Lana Zak speak with Waylon Wuertz, owner of Wuertz Gourd Farm, about how the water restrictions are affecting his business.

Name: Man indicted in 1986 murder of 20-year-old college student
description: Essex District Attorney Jonathan Blodgett said John Carey, 63, will be charged with first-degree murder in the death of Claire Gravel.

Name: Harvey Weinstein granted appeal of his 2020 rape conviction
description: Weinstein was sentenced to 23 years in prison for sexually assaulting two women.

Name: Marjorie Taylor Greene's home targeted in swatting call, police say
description: A suspect later admitted to making the call, police said.

Name: 4 wounded in drive-by shooting near Chicago high school
description: The four people were outside an ice cream shop when they were shot.

Name: 13-year-old girl is fourth person arrested after death of NYC cab driver
description: A 13-year-old girl is the latest person to be arrested in the fatal beating of a New York City cab driver.

Name: Prized Galileo manuscript turns out to be a fake, university says
description: The document highlighting the discovery of Jupiter's moons​, described as one of the "jewels" of the library's collection, appears to have actually been written in the 20th century.

Name: NASA begins final preparations for maiden flight of $4.1 billion SLS rocket
description: NASA plans to launch its new moon rocket on August 29 to kick off a long-awaited 42-day mission.

Name: NASA reveals new Webb telescope images of Jupiter's auroras, tiny moons
description: These are the most detailed images to date of the solar system's largest planet.

Name: "The most ridiculously detailed" photo of the moon has arrived
description: The duo took thousands of photos to create the glowing image of Earth's lunar companion – and it does not disappoint.

Name: NASA astronaut Nicole Aunapu Mann will make history in space
description: Astronaut Nicole Aunapu Mann will serve as mission commander and make history as the first Native American woman in space this fall.

Name: Cities with the worst traffic in the world
description: Traffic software company TomTom has listed the places with the worst traffic delays  – and, yes, one U.S. city makes the list.

Name: Rare photos from the 1976 Chowchilla bus kidnapping
description: A look inside the truck trailer where 26 abducted school children and their bus driver were buried alive -- and later escaped.

Name: Taliban marks "Victory Day" a year after Afghan takeover
description: While many Afghans have little to celebrate, the country's Taliban rulers were happy to show off their control of Kabul's streets.

Name: The Circleville letters: You've got hate mail
description: An anonymous letter writer terrorizes a small town, threatening to expose their rumored dark secrets.

Name: Timeline: The Jonelle Matthews case
description: Inside the case against Steven Pankey, a former political candidate who was tried for the kidnapping and murder of a Colorado 12-year-old.

Name: Latest Videos
description: President Biden Wednesday announced a plan to forgive up to $20,000 in federal student loans for certain borrowers earning less that $125,000 annually. U.S. Education Secretary Miguel Cardona joined "Red and Blue" to discuss the benefits of the initiative.

Name: Islamic militants responsible for Somalia attack
description: The Islamic militant group Al-Shabaab claimed reponsibility for a deadly attack in Somalia's capital on Sunday. At least 20 people were killed and more than 100 were injured. Bruce Hoffman, a senior fellow for the Council on Foreign Relations, joined CBS News' John Dickerson to discuss.

Name: Vanessa Bryant awarded $16M over crash site photos
description: A jury Wednesday awarded Vanessa Bryant $16 million in the trial over photos of the helicopter crash site where Kobe Bryant and their daughter died, along with seven others. Carter Evans has the latest.

Name: Report: Trump-allied attorneys led effort to copy election data
description: Attorneys allied with former President Donald Trump led an effort to copy 2020 presidential election data from several states, according to a report in the Washington Post. Jon Swaine, one of the investigative reporters who covered the story for the Post, joined CBS News to discuss what he found.

Name: At least 15 journalists killed in Mexico so far in 2022
description: 2022 has been one of the deadliest years ever for journalists in Mexico. Jan-Albert Hootsen, a Mexico representative for the nonprofit Committee to Protect Journalists, joins CBS News to discuss the violence against reporters in Mexico.
